subject: Sleep
title: Deep Sleep and the Immune System
description: A fast breakdown of Deep Sleep and the Immune System for builders.

hook.text: When you have the flu, you sleep much more than usual. Your body is demanding extra deep sleep for a reason.

buildup.text: During N3, the immune system ramps up production of cytokines, proteins that coordinate immune responses.

discovery.text: T cells, the soldiers of your immune system, become more effective at attacking infected cells during N3.

twist.text: Losing just one night of deep sleep measurably reduces your next-day immune defense.

climax.text: Chronic loss of deep sleep is linked to higher rates of infection and slower wound healing.

punchline.text: Deep sleep is when your immune army trains.

quiz.question: What does the immune system do during deep sleep?
options: It shuts down to conserve energy
It ramps up cytokine production and T cell activity
